alert.note: Alert for Cook; Itasca; Koochiching; Lake; St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 12 at 4:01PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WARMING TEMPERATURES WILL LEAD TO A MELTING SNOWPACK AND POSSIBLE FLOODING BY MID TO LATE WEEK... Seasonably very warm temperatures continue through the end of the week and will continue to lead to melting of the deep and primed snowpack over the Borderlands and Minnesota Arrowhead. Enhanced runoff from the melting snowpack is expected to start or continue. Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams and in low-lying and flood prone locations is possible especially if culverts become blocked. Additionally, as flows increase on area rivers that are popular for waterfall viewing, visitors should expect snow and ice covered trails and be careful around rivers that will have slippery rocks, cliffs, and strong currents. If you live in an area that has previously experienced spring flooding impacts, expect to experience those problems again this year. The next update to this outlook is expected by 4:00PM Friday, April 14, 2023.

area.areaDesc: Cook; Itasca; Koochiching; Lake; St. Louis
